description:
This module will introduce students to the general principles of

drug actions that underpin their therapeutic applications

against cancers, from conventional (non-specific)

chemotherapy to target-specific drugs. It will provide details of

drugs used in specific cancer types, ranging from those with

proven efficacy in clinics (e.g. Gleevec) to experimental agents

in trials. Conceptual and theoretical targets (e.g. RNAi and

gene therapies) will also be introduced.
title: Cancer Pharmacology
faculty: Yong Loo Lin Sch of Medicine
